reviews.review_msg: You will go into the midterm thinking you are confident in the material, only to get absolutely destroyed. In the pre-recorded lecture from 2017, the class avg for the midterm was 55%. You could understand the assignments and quizzes and get high marks on those, only to somehow get wrecked on the midterm. Overall unclear expectations for the exam.

I signed up for a methods class, what I got was a shotty trip down philosophy lane. The history and philosophical underpinnings are important, but should not constitute the bulk of a research methods class.

BOORRRRRING.  Likes to say "ergo", "part and parcel", and "vis-a-vis" a lot!  Not at all funny, and I need something in a qualitative stats class to keep me going.  Unnecessarily extensive materials/readings.
He really is a nice guy.  He is a fair marker, and people who fail his class can only blame themselves.
He's a washed out cop wannabe. Contradicted himself often on project requirements.  Talks like he's 6'4, but he's barely 5'9.  Smug and arrogant.  I hope he stays sessional.
Garth is one of the worst profs i've ever had.  He's both arrogant and aggressive.

Garth is an incredible professor.  Sure he may come off a little aggressive in class but outside class he is very helpful and friendly. And while it may seem like a lot of work, I feel incredibly confident in my research abilities thanks to Garth

Garth is great!  He may be aggressive and arrogant in class, but visit him outside of class and he is a great guy.  He is down to earth and has great stories and advice.  I did really well in his class so I have no complaints.
hey buddy take him for crim 321 and see if you still think he is a good prof have fun in that class wink
He is very intelligent and a great teacher

I have had Davies for 2 courses and these have been the courses I have hated the most. True, they were both research methods but his personality and workload make it a lot worse than it has to be. 3 friggin research projects for only 20% each sucks!
Good prof but scary personality. The workload is huge. O.k. we students in University courses expect a lot of work but this is nuts! This class should be taken just by itself.
No Comments
No Comments
Certainly has a great knowledge of research methods. However, he fails to understand students have many other classes and commitments (i.e.jobs), as the workload is very strenuous.

Garth, you need to stop being so arrogant and abrasive towards your students.  We are here to learn, not to be ridiculed.  You have so much knowledge, yet your sarcasm detracts from the enjoyment of your class.

AVOID. her instructions for the paper are all over the place it's so hard to find the modules with it since they are all over canvas. Nor are they properly explained. I am willing to bet just her class alone in a sem is enough to drive you nuts and be very heavy. The TA Shana nor her herself are of any help, they just direct you towards modules.

She's a good person. She handled everything well during the TA strike and she was very considerate to everyone's situation. She cares about your learning and were open to students coming to talk to her during office hours. Very accessible and responsive through emails. Lectures consisted of group discussions to help you learn.

Extremely picky about minor details. She should be an English prof if she wants to critique every little thing. Speaks down to students sometimes. Makes the content more confusing. Expected way too much for the research project (30% of grade) and set unrealistic expectations.
Bring a pillow to her class so when you lose consciousness your head wont slam on your desk. And bring a pillow for your pillow because your pillow will fall asleep too.
Worst prof at SFU

Sheri is a great person, and a very accessible and helpful person. That said, this class was extremely difficult--you have to conduct your own research study, which takes no less than 60 hours of work, if not more. TAs are hard markers, and expect you to adopt Sheri's method of thinking and if you don't, you won't do well. Take 321 online if u can.

Amazing lecturer. Everyone says the course content is boring but if you enjoyed CRIM220 and are serious about research, you'll enjoy it a lot with Sheri. Her expectations are crystal-clear and her feedback is essential for success in this course. If you follow her guidelines and do what she tells you to do. You'll end up with a decent grade.

amazing professor/person, really cares about her students. overall boring class. TA was condescending and rarely helpful, always told us to "ask sheri." sheri is the only good thing about 321. if you're going through a hard time, she is extremely accommodating and there for support whenever needed. Would take another class with her for sure!

I like Sheri a lot as a professor, though this class was not my favourite. Yes, the material is dry... what do you expect? It's research methods. She really tries to have people engage through the process of research. She is extremely clear in her expectations, which many other profs are not. She is also very helpful in her office hours.

Course content is boring by itself (I mean, research methods, come on...), but Sheri tries her best to make things interesting and to engage the class. It's clear that she wants her students to succeed and is available for help whenever students need it. She gives good feedback and recognizes effort. I'd take another course with her in a heartbeat.

Yes, the workload is tough. But this is a required methodology course - why wouldn't it be? She's one of the most helpful profs I've ever had at SFU. She is crystal clear with her requirements and really anyone who wants to put in the necessary effort can get an A. She provides you with everything you need to do well. Slides aren't posted so attend

Sheri's lectures are really straightforward and easy to follow, research methods is a boring subject so the lectures are not interesting AT ALL but she tries to engage the class. Wouldn't recommend taking this class unless you have to. There is a HUGE project at the end that takes a lot of time and effort !

Workload is crazy. One 8 page paper, a final research project which you work on the entire term (20 pages), plus weekly discussions online and a presentation. And of course the final, which is 3 essay questions. She's helpful and knows what she's doing, but say goodbye to your social life. Boring af

Great teacher. She is very clear, and to the point on what she wants for the final paper. Go to lectures, she is very helpful. Gives a lot of examples for how to write paper, and what is on the final.

Took 131 with her and it went alright. Went with her again for 321 hoping for more of the same and boy was I wrong. The expectations she gives out for the final assignment might seem clear at first, but once you get get going, you realize what she wants is entirely something else

I was a little hesitant after the first lecture, but take a "leap of faith" with her. This is the first class that I have had with her and she's amazing. Go to her office hours and she is more than willing to help you with your reserach paper. She's a prof who cares, which is rare.  Abby is a great TA as well!

CRIM 321 is generally a very boring and dry class, but she made it interesting for us and tried her hardest to get us involved. As others have said, effort reflects your grade - she's very helpful and nice. If don't understand something, ask for help.  You're in university, don't expect everything to be handed down to you.

Sheri is very helpful outside of lecture, but this class is boring, and she is very repetitive. I didn't think the majority of the readings or coursework were necessary to write the research paper. The paper should be worth 50% and there should be no exam. Would probably not take a class with her again. TA Abby is great.

Sheri is a very helpful teacher and tries to make a tough class manageable. Overall, the class if very difficult, but if you put in the effort you can expect a good grade. Do not get Kristen Sanders as your TA, as she marks really hard and is useless for help. Abby Kolb is the better TA who is actually helpful.

You know,I heard/read so many bad things about her;Which I am now convinced were written by lazy students who were pissed they had to think for themselves(sorry but you're in university and are not allowed to plagiarize)and actually read the textbook/attend class.Sheri makes it pretty easy,is SOOO helpful&WILL cut you slack if you show you care

Expect to work hard for your mark. Expect that you will have to try your very best. And, after you're done her class, expect that every other class from now on will be SO MUCH easier because you kno the essentials needed and you've learned what u need to succeed in University. Take her if you're not an idiot. Highly recommended.

Hard prof with high expectations especialli for the research project! Changes the APA guidelines to what she wants. final exam- 3 essay questions , there is no structured review guideline! Stay away from Fabian and teaching assistant : Kristen Sanders who is the most terrible T.A I have ever had !! Get a different professor, Fabian is a hard marker
Sheri Fabian is fair to some extent but I feel that she should not be teaching research based courses as her expectations are a little high for undergraduates

321 is generally a horrible course, but Sheri was really helpful and tried her best to help students understand the material and even attempted to make us appreciate the art of qualitative research. She makes herself very avaialble during office hours (especially close to paper time!) and her tests and paper guidelines are very clear. Great prof!

Sheri made qualitative methods harder than it really needed to be. She wouldn't give students concrete answers which made it all the more confusing. Class is mandatory so you can't expect to be engaged for long periods of time. Pray you get a good TA  and all will be well.
hated the class...hated the teacher...her lectures were dull and boring....she said things would get clear...still waiting for that to happen!!!!!!

Even though Qualitative research is a dreaded class, I would say that Fabian made it very bearable. The text was easy to follow and her lectures are VERY organized and easy to understand. The assignments are not too hard with enough effort. I never received help from her, but she is supposed to be very helpful during office hours.TAKE 321 w/FABIAN!
Sheri is super helpful. I never knew doing interviews and putting everything together can be so interesting. Go to her office hours and she'll do her best to help you out.

Throughout the semster she says things will become more clear, but they never do. When people ask questions in lecture, she asks students to answer the question, and you never get the answer. You learn nothing in this class with her teaching it.
The papers were complex enough but she had to throw more into the mix.  Also, I felt like she was accusing us of plagarism every class when we hadn't even handed anything in yet.
I would never take her again. She keeps saying that she will explain things later, things will be more clear as we go on, but nothing ever got clarified.
I would not recommend her to anyone. Although Fabian knows what she's doing, the students have no clue. She makes qual. harder than it should be and the text, well, that just makes it worse.
I took this class with Sheri because I was told she was fun and made qualitative research fun - not the case. So boring. She doesn't clarify anything. Would never recommend her to anyone.
Sheri is a hard ass but in a good way she realy helped my writing.
boring

wow....my experiences are so different. Maybe she is good as a prof but i would never in a million years take a class with her after having her as a TA....she was insanely hard! She practically expected a masters thesis from and undergraduate class!
Tee Hee Hee! I gave you a chili pepper!

Overworked yet Underpaid! This is an individual who goes above and beyond who also has the requsite skills desired but seldom found in a TA. I wish someone like Sher marked all my papers (although she won't give a mark away, if they are deducted you actually deserved it).

Ted is awesome! He is kind, understanding and easily reachable. The term research project wasn't too heavy and he gives you all the tools needed to do well. The paper is a bit long (15 pages) but involves little outside research. His exams are incredibly easy (all written content application questions) as long as you've at least done the readings.

A really sweet professor! The lectures may be hard to sit through sometimes but class overall wad not that difficult. 15 page paper is not bad in comparison to the ones written for other crim classes. I would recommend taking 321 with this prof.

Pretty chill professor. The class isn't too hard. Do your lecture notes and weekly readings and you will be good. Prepares you for exams very well, so please listen to his tips when he gives them. The paper may seem overwhelming because of the word count. However, it's actually doable if you start writing early. Take 321 if Ted is teaching it

Wish the instructor was more engaging... he's very very nice, but I do echo the other reviews, he's stuck in the 90's tech. Suggestion: use ahaslides, Kahoots, etc... but otherwise the content is really dull.

If you can separate the professor from the course, Ted is seriously a joy to take a class with. I can see why other students may think he's "boring", but honestly he just has a kind, calm demeanor and is working with some pretty dry content (qualitative research). Do the study questions and know them well, you'll do perfectly well in this course.

Professor Palys is an absolute sweetheart. Although his lectures can be super bland and boring. He seems to really care about what he does and his studies. The final and midterm are pretty easy as long as you pay some what attention to the material. Definitely recommend taking Ted for your CRIM 321 Mandatory.

Very passionate prof, a shame he is stuck in the 90s technology-wise. Does not use a Canvas page, and has his own website which I'm sorry is ridiculous in 2022. Lectures are long and boring, dry content goes overtime a lot. No clear guidelines for a 15-page paper, nice guy, but his disdain for using technology is frustrating when we pay for Canvas
Ted is a boring lecturer. He is nearly impossible to pay attention to with how boring the lectures are. He seems to be a nice guy. It does not help that the content is so dry.

Ted is a very nice professor and it is clear that he is very passionate about qualitative research methods. This course only had 2 exams and and a major paper so mostly you just need to keep up with your readings. Tests are all written but wasn't bad if you understand material. Also the major paper is maximum 15 pages but can be slightly shorter.

Does not use Canvas ugh uses his own website from the 90s. Does not record lectures but does post slides. Very monotone lectures and goes overtime. Exams are all based on study questions he provides for each ch of the text. Reading the text is a must. Instructions for the final paper were vague and no clue how it was graded. Tutorials not mandatory

Ted is encouraging, caring, and fair with his students. The material can be dry at times, but he's knowledgeable and well experienced in qualitative research. He makes the material interesting with real life examples and his own research projects. The term project was fair and he prepared you well for it. You learn some pretty cool stuff.

Ted is really encouraging to his students and cares about the success of everybody in his class. The material can be dry at times but his knowledge is evident and can break things down thats easy to understand. We did one big term paper that as worth 50% but he gives tons of feedback and help. Would totally take a class with him again.

Great prof! Very articulate, and explained concepts well. Exams were clear cut - no tricks or anything of that sort. He was very clear about his expectations for the research paper. His course was planned out extremely well. Class could sometimes get a bit dry due to the course content, but he made it as enjoyable as it could be.

Well to a professor that was never at his office during office hours as given in the syllabus I can't say much positive about him.  In fact, I would go as far as to say to not use his book as referencing anyone's work.

Fantastic prof and class. Dr. Palys is very passionate in his lecture. Very helpful and friendly to all of us. He is very clear on what he expects in the project and the exams. Research project is fun and worthwhile to do. Rebecca is a great TA. Glad that I had a chance to take a class with Dr. P!

After not quite four years of Crim, this was the most exciting and fulfilling class I've taken. The oral history project was fascinating. Prof. Palys is just excellent -- great lecturer and very interested in his students. The project is a lot of work but very fulfilling. Very straightforward exams, too.

Man this course is brutal but he does make it bearable. Midterm was easy. Paper was okay. Final was easy. His TA's are completely useless. He, however, is extremely helpful. Awesome professor with a great attitude. Overall, not bad. But bearable for a pre-req.
Palys is awesome; He helps if you ask for it. He tells you exactly what he wants for exams and term paper. I would for sure take a class with him again!

Dr. P is a great prof, but the class really sucks. His tone and material is quite boring and I dont think I learned a whole lot from the class. The paper seemed like a cake walk even though it was 20 pages. it was a very weird paper because ti didn't take form like a regular third year paper

qualitative research is confusing as it is, he asked for oral history for the term project, but even now I dont exactly know what the diffrence is between oral history and interview!!! he is very interested in the topic himself though. some lectures can be boring though the paper was not as hard as i thought, easy to fill 20 pages

I don't know why he gets such a bad rap b/c he's really not that bad. He is genuinely interested in getting to know his students and it shows.  He's a very nice, well spoken guy and does a decent job making a boring course definately bearable.
Boring, No-Humor, Not willing to help. Would not recommend taking 321 with this guy.

I really enjoyed this class. The 20 page article seems really hard at first but I really enjoyed writing it and I did quite well. When I went to Ted's office he was very helpful and seemed like a really nice guy. TA Lorinda was great! Mid-term seemed a bit tricky but final was really easy!

I cannot believe this class is mandatory, it was the biggest waste of time/credits I have ever taken. there was no textbook, only a series of journal articles, to make our lives difficult. His exams were ridiculous, and he threw us what seemed like trick questions. Nice guy though?

The class was an overall OK.  The 20-page research paper was worth half of the grade, and the exams were fairly straightforward.  Don't bother buying the textbook - completely useless. Palys is somewhat boring, but posts most of his lecture notes online.

It was distance ed so your experience will heavily depend on the TM. The video lectures she posted were clearly made several years ago and had outdated course information on them, which was confusing. I'd recommend taking this class in person since qualitative research does not come easy, especially with little to no support online.

I asked for clarification around the research guideline and was simply told to just "follow the guidelines". I wouldn't be asking for clarification if I didn't read the guideline. We are not even given a template as other profs have given. I have never had an indifferent and dismissive prof and ta as this class. The prof herself is not accessible.

Basically have to teach yourself everything about qualitative research methods, no support from the prof and TA's don't have regular office hours. Avoid this prof for 321. TA's should hold officer hours.

distance-ed course:, the guidelines and lectures are so little and broad that you are dumbfounded on what to do. Many CRIM students are not adept at qualitative research, and this prof does not do a good job at all in preparing you for your final project. Her lectures are outdated, and does not cover content analysis.  DO NOT RECOMMEND

Took this course through distance ed with TM Chantal. One of worst experiences ever. This TM marked quite harsh and nit-picked every small error, docking many marks for mistakes. The course could have gone a lot smoother if the TM was different.

I took it DE with TA Stephanie who is awesome! The workload is manageable (2 papers, a short presentation, 1 final). Discussion marks are somewhat ambiguous - I wrote paragraphs each week & combined all relevant readings, and was surprised by a lower mark - so beware. Overall, 321 w/ Jacqueline is a great option and it is fairly easy to do well!

I took this class online with her. I'm not a great writer at all, but the guidelines for the assignments are really straightforward. If you still need to take 321. I really reccomend taking the class onlike with her.

Not as hard as expected, but not "easy." Both papers (one 8 page; one 16 page) have clear guidelines to follow. Final exam (5 long answer, 1 essay) was based on the objectives found in each module. Make sure you participate, class avg for discussions was only 66% bc people thought it would be easy marks. Overall, definitely a good option for 321.

heard the class is suppose to be very difficult but it turned out to be fine. Easy. The final was pretty easy and not difficult to study for, i stressed way too much. Lots of online discussions though..weekly! Take the class she is very nice and i also had a nice TA asheka. I guess it depends on the ta you get too because they do all the marking.

took CRIM 321 dis ed, the material is not hard to learn but is extremely boring. there are interesting topics for the essay but it depends on who your TA is because he/she does the marking. as for the final designed by jacqueline, it's not hard but you have to know A LOT. questions are not hard to answer, but they require a LOT of details to answer

of the 4 required crim classes, this was by far my favourite! (i took it dis-ed). it wasn't as hard as i had expected, and i thought the readings were interesting. i really liked this class... probably because i got to write an academic paper about graffiti!

i took this class through dist ed.  Faubert laid out the guidelines and the requirements.  Other than than the TA, Marla, did all the grading and answering of the questions.  She does not give clarification prior to writing papers, online discussions, or tests.  Basically, you have to read the course package and figure things out.

it's qualitative research...how interesting could that be? at lest she makes it more barrable. I took her through distance ed. usually profs dont do anything in dis-ed classes, she's different. she posts comments, and reads our comments, it's great to have a prof that cares so much! i recommend any class with her
Slides can be printed out on WebCT. She really knows her stuff. The courseload was quite heavy, although a lot of the readings can be ignored. Lectures go on and on and on.....
Boring lectures. She knows her stuff, but talks way too much. Assignments are fair and easy to follow.

Was arrogant and dismissive. Actually had the nerve to sit back in his chair ( leaning) with his feet up while addressing the class. Made the class by a novel that wasn't even used. He prefers people who agree with him.

Took Via Distance Ed.  I dont know about the prof as I have not met him but avoid this class if your TA is Brittany Boyer!! She is extremly picky and does not hesitant to fail your essay regardless of your other marks
